parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It discusses the need for modernization of electricity distribution networks in Europe, a general topic related to energy infrastructure and not directly tied to any candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content addresses a broad audience interested in energy policy and infrastructure in Europe. The reach estimate (100K-500K) further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to raise awareness about the need for modernization of electricity distribution networks. While energy policy might be a topic discussed during elections, this post does not explicitly advocate for or against any particular candidate or party's stance on this issue. The content is informative and analytical in nature, focusing on a general societal problem.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information in a manner consistent with journalistic reporting. It cites a source ("Eurelectric") and presents a factual argument regarding the need for investment in energy infrastructure. The link directs to an article on the topic, further supporting its journalistic nature.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it presents an argument based on information from a reputable source (Eurelectric). The tone is objective and analytical, not opinionated or emotionally charged.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2519384234917057</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, focusing on the need for modernization of Europe's electricity distribution networks, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  It lacks any direct or indirect reference to specific parliamentary candidates or parties. The content is primarily informative and analytical, consistent with journalistic reporting, and aims to raise awareness about a general societal issue, not to influence voters in a particular election. The post does not meet the criteria outlined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, as it does not directly refer to a candidate or party, its objective is not primarily electoral, and it remains within the boundaries of journalistic reporting.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>eoficial.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
